title: The Speaker must allow Parliament a vote on Boris Johnson's deal
text:
Another week ushers in yet another political crisis. The seemingly never-ending Brexit saga, which should have been brought to some sort of resolution on so-called “Super Saturday” in the Commons, stumbles on after MPs scuppered Boris Johnson’s deal with the EU just as they had wrecked the efforts of his predecessor. However, the Prime Minister is arguably in a better position than Theresa May because the Commons has strictly not rejected his agreement, since it was not put to a vote.

The Government will try again today to secure the required “meaningful vote” with John Bercow, the Speaker, expected to rule on whether it is in order to do so. He must let the vote happen. The country will not...
